My single room was small, but very comfortable (the weather was cold and rainy when I arrived . . . the hospitality and the room were warm). There is a phone in the room with free calling to anywhere, which in my case was a godsend. The computer with internet connection, which is downstairs by the breakfast room, was very convenient and modern.

reviews.text: But the best thing beyond everything I've mentioned so far was the pancake and fruit smoothie served in addition to the fabulous breakfast. Both were so incredibly tasty, most especially the pancake (really, almost as thin as a crepe). Perhaps it was a special recipe that made each of them so good, but it very well could have been that they were served by wonderful, caring individuals.

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Fita from the 6th to the 9th April this year. The staff were very friendly, breakfast was great, room and bathroom were clean. The free laundry service and internet service was a big bonus. The only thing after reading the reviews about the owners we were sad to find out upon arrival they were away visiting their daughter. Oh well maybe next time.
reviews.title: Excellent small hotel

reviews.text: We arrived in the morning after a long airplane flight, and were given the choice of two rooms, one which was clean and ready, the other just vacated. The other room had a small balcony that overlooked a playground and we thought it was worth the wait. We changed clothes and (at the owner's suggestion) we took a canal ride from a boat about a block from the hotel. Then back for a much-needed nap. The Van Gogh museum is around the block and the hotel will sell you tickets, avoiding a long line. The owners and staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms immaculate, and the location exactly what we wanted for Amsterdam. It was easy to get there using the trolley, next to parks, canals and museums. Even though it was in the middle of a large city, the immediate neighborhood felt residential - during the day we could hear the happy sounds of children playing and at night it was quiet.
reviews.title: THIS HOTEL TICKS ALL THE BOXES

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple

Breakfast was excellent with good choice and delicious pancakes. All the staff were very friendly and helpful and this is the hotel we would come back to again.
reviews.title: Hotel Fita made this our best trip to Amsterdam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We won't repeat the details in the previous reviews, but will just say that they are all true: this is a wonderful little hotel, absolutely spotlessly clean. Fine breakfast buffet. The location is spectacular, and the nearby #2 and 5 streetcars will take you everywhere (7-8 minute ride to within 4 blocks of the Anne Frank House, for example); we never waited more than 5 minutes for one. The Van Gogh museum is 75 yards away, and the Concertgebouw three blocks. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. One earlier review carped about the small elevator: yes, it's not large, but two people plus some luggage fit easily, and most hotels don't have an elevator at all. Among the other amenities: free laundry service. Just an outstanding value, all around.
reviews.title: As good as the reviews say

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently booked four nights at the Hotel Fita that unexpectedly resulted in becoming ten nights due to the explosion of volcano Eyjafjallajokull on Thursday April 14th two days before our departure. Hans and Loes, along with the entire staff of the Hotel Fita treated us and the other "stranded" guests kindly. Everyone was able to extend their stay. The free Internet and Wi-Fi, along with the free telephone (local and long distance) helped keep everyone connected. The hotel is in an excellent location for the museums, trams and restaurants. The rooms are clean, comfortable and well maintained. We had room number six the least expensive and it was perfectly adequate--comfortable bed, good size bathroom (great water pressure), TV and a couple of chairs. The room has a wardrobe cabinet. My wife and I have been traveling to Europe for fifteen years, we pack light and are prepared to wash clothes out in the sink and hang them to dry. So, having the free laundry was really nice. We placed our clothes in the laundry basket gave them to Hans, and when we stopped back after lunch the clothes were in the room. The breakfast was very enjoyable. We ate in a comfortable room, were served coffee or tea, fresh squeezed juice and pancakes every morning. The buffet included eggs, meat, cheese, fresh fruit, breads, Hans' homemade jam, granola, yogurt and cereal. During breakfast Hans was always available to answer questions, give advice or just chat. It was also an opportunity to talk with the other guest and share suggestions about things to do or restaurants to go to. It is a family run business whose owners make their guests feel like family. If your only reason for travel is to check things off your list then maybe it doesn't matter where you stay. But, if you travel in order to meet new people and experience other cultures, then where you stay is part of your visit. The people at the Hotel Fita made our stay in Amsterdam a visit. They are wonderful hosts who sincerely care about their guests.
reviews.title: Friendly and Kind

reviews.text: Note about Eyjafjallajokull: The time during the eruption of Eyjafjallajokull was stressful. Planes were grounded across Europe and no one knew when the eruption was going to end and when we could get back home. In spite of the inconvenience and anxiety that accompanied this event, two blessings came out of it. First, though over a million people were affected no one was hurt. Second, we had the good fortune to spend those days at the Hotel Fita with Hans and Loes, the hotel staff and the other guests whom we met. I'm thankful everyone returned home safe and maybe in five years we'll have a reunion.
reviews.title: Wonderful location near beautiful Vondel Park and Museums

reviews.text: My husband traveled to Amsterdam on business, and I accompanied him. Because of the vocano erruption and the closing of the airport (Schippol) we had an extended "vacation" in lovely Amsterdam. The hotel was very nice, comfortable and in a wonderful location. We walked all over the city, and rented bikes on three separate occasions. We were very well treated and respected by the friendly staff, and would stay there again. (price was 159 Euros per night, queen bed and private bath.)

reviews.text: In April 2008, I spent four nights at Hotel Fita. I made reservations there based on the reviews I had read. I was not disappointed. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was very good and was a wonderful way to start each day. As others mentioned, the rooms were relatively small, very clean and functional, but very sufficient for my purposes. I arrived after an overnight flight about 10 a.m. with the expectation that I would be able to leave my bags there since check-in wasn't until 3. My room was available so they let me check in right away and I was very thankful that they did as it allowed me to take a short nap and relax. I would be hard pressed to find a downside to this hotel, but the only one would be that they are located right next to a small playground that can get a little noisy during school hours. Thank you Hotel Fita for providing such excellent service and thank you to TripAdvisor for letting me know you exist!

reviews.text: We have just returned from a joint short break with our American friends in Hotel Fita. We were made to feel very welcome and comfortable. With free telephone (international and international), a splendid new coffee machine, free internet and coffee/tea making facilities in our room, this small family hotel provides more services than larger, more luxurious hotels.
The location is excellent, with the Rijksmuseum at the end of the road, the Van Gogh museum around the corner and Concertgebouw within walking distance.
reviews.title: A perfect hotel!

reviews.text: After reading the reviews, I was excited about my upcoming visit to Amsterdam. Yes the hotel is run by super friendly people, yes the breakfast is good, yes the free internet and phone calls are definitely a perk, yes the free laundry is a luxury and the location to a couple of trams is great. The only thing I would say is that the room felt a bit that for a family run hotel, there could be a little more charm and or character. The bathrooms (large in size) have soap dispensers on the wall, same with the shower. There is no shampoo provided which I was prepared for but it would have been a nice touch. We were in a room on the bottom floor which faced a school. This wasn't a problem because we were out site seeing when school let out but it was a concern at first. Don't get me wrong, I have traveled extensively so I know what is out there. I guess it was just a little hyped up. Overall is was a good hotel and we got a great deal. It's just hard because we came from such a charming B&B in Brugge that I can't help but compare.
reviews.title: Hotel Fita

reviews.text: We were 4 Aussie couples who were spending the last few days of a five week holiday in Amsterdam. We were delighted with our choice of Hotel Fita. On arrival the owner Hans greeted us with some peach cider and nibbles. A very nice touch. The hotel was in a quiet location,yet handy to trams & museums. Our romms were clean, and spacious with a large bathroom , an ironing board & iron, tea & coffee making facilities , writing desk, and two comfy chairs. Everything a traveller could want. Breakfasts were good, fresh orangeg juice, fruit, cereal, cheeses, toast, and cooked breakfast. Hans was only too happy to give advice on what to do and where to go and our group were very happy with his individual recommendations. Four of us had a late flight home and for an extra fee were were able to secure a room for a late check out. We were given fresh towells, making the prospect of our long haul home to Australia easier.
Only imporvementI could suggest: Australians do not like powdered milk in the tea. Fresh is best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a three week vacation in Europe and had the pleasure of staying one week at the wonderful Hotel Fita in Amsterdam. Upon our arrival we were offered a welcome drink from the owner himself, Hans, who is a very funny and entertaining fellow. This hotel is in a beautiful location, close to all the museums and within walking distance to everything. They also sell tickets to most museums at a discount. The staff is very friendly and helpful with any questions or recommendations to make your stay in Amsterdam very pleasant. The hotel offers free internet and phone calls (just do not take advantage) and a very nice buffet breakfast. Most hotel rooms in Europe are very small, but we had a nice size medium double room, large bathroom, small balcony, overall very comfortable. We absolutely loved the Hotel Fita in Amsterdam and will definitely stay there again on our next trip to Amsterdam. We have been to Amsterdam on several occasions and I must say the Hotel Fita is the best hotel we have visited.

I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone.

reviews.text: I really liked this hotel. We spent Easter in Amsterdam at the Hotel Fita, and we were really glad we did. The hotel is smart and clean, in a quiet street very close to the museums, but a short tram ride from the rest of the city. Our room was big and bright, overlooking a side street even quieter than the quiet street which the hotel sits on. It had a big bathroom, a good quality coffee maker, and a reasonable bed. The breakfast is splendid, with the pancakes and freshly-squeezed juices as mentioned elsewhere, as well as good coffee, excellent cheese and vanilla-flecked yoghurt.
reviews.title: Great place, in a great place

reviews.text: All of the staff are great. Some reviewers have described problems with the owner, Hans and he is a bit eccentric. We witnessed a hilarious encounter between him and a rather ponderous guest who clearly wanted to ask him something, but was taking forever to do it during a busy breakfast session. Put it this way - Hans made it clear that he wanted him to get to the point. But we found him charming and helpful, and besides, if you want bland and robotic service, stay at a big international chain hotel. This is a good quality, individual hotel. I liked it (and Hans) a lot, and when we return to Amsterdam, we'll stay here again.
